Deficiency Narrative: Medication log reviewed for one child contained missing dosages and was not recorded as a medication error.
Correction Narrative: Documentation received from RTC Supervisor on 8/5/25 reflects an "Employee Counseling Notice" Form that will be used moving forward. This form will include the reason for counseling, employee's statement, and action to be taken.

Deficiency Narrative: Food was left in the sink to defrost.
Correction Narrative: Email received by operation supervisor with an attached document of the daily checklist staff must complete and sign prior to leaving their shift. This includes: "dishes washed, counters wiped down, swept and put away dishes (NO LEFTOVERS)"

Deficiency Narrative: Refrigerator had crumbs and syrup stuck to the bottom of the refrigerator in the drawer area.
Correction Narrative: Email received by operation supervisor with an attached document of the daily checklist staff must complete and sign prior to leaving their shift. This includes: "dishes washed, counters wiped down, swept and put away dishes (NO LEFTOVERS)"

Deficiency Narrative: The Service Plan of a child in care clearly notes the Level of Care as IPTP and night checks should be completed every 10 minutes, specifically from 10PM until midnight. Night Logs note checks were being completed every 10 minutes until 9PM and every hour after 9PM.
Correction Narrative: An email was received by the administrator stating that the supervision requirement of the Service Plans are being reviewed and will be highlighted on the log to ensure checks are being completed at the designated rates and times.

Deficiency Narrative: Licensing observed and photographed broken glass pieces on the ground outside a window at Terry Cabin, which staff indicated had been there for two weeks. The staff cleaned up all broken glass pieces during the inspection.
Correction Narrative: A broken window had been replaced by a contractor who did not clean the broken glass from the site.  In the future maintenance will follow-up after a contractor has completed a task and assure the area is free of garbage and debris.

Deficiency Narrative: A time notation is not present in the unauthorized absence log.
Correction Narrative:
On 6/4/24 the following email was received from administrator: We are currently working with our database to automatically generate the log and working with the glitch that leaves that information off some reports. In the future we will fill that information in manually if the database is not able to report it.

Interview with Administrator and documentation provided showed updated annual summary log to continue reflecting the time the child was discovered and now includes the staff who filled out the form and staff who is supervising that child at the time of absence. Moving forward, extended reach is utilized to fill out incident reports and this will populate in the updated unauthorized summary log.

Deficiency Narrative: Reports to licensing was made outside of the required time frame.
Correction Narrative:
Reports to licensing was made outside of the required time frame. 

On 6/12/24 conducted a physical follow-up. Requested documentation how staff would be notified of the new change in contacting the hotline within 2 hrs. of notifing law enforcement. This will be left pending as of 6/12/24, and notification will be provided at the latest on 7/7/24.

Deficiency Narrative: A debriefing was not conducted with one of the resident involved within the required time frame.
Correction Narrative: 3 staff interviewed and documentation provided reflects that the new incident report includes the documentation of the debriefing with child upon returning to the operation with details on what the discussion will be about.

Deficiency Narrative: 2 children records reviewed showed medical log is missing staff signature after administering medications.
Correction Narrative: Reviewed 12 records and all contained signatures of where medication was dispensed properly.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff interviewed confirmed they informed the children they had to be in line of sight but then went inside the house for a brief period, leaving two children unattended.
Correction Narrative: 3 staff were interviewed and conducted a recent supervision training held on 2/19/24. The following topics were covered, " why it's important, on ranch, off ranch, recreation, in the ranch, prohibited Areas, At chapel, and know your children." Training completion log was collected as well.

Deficiency Narrative: Video footage confirmed that staff was not present for long periods of time and child interviews confirmed that staff was not present for long periods of time. Video footage showed two children laying on a couch together for a few minutes without staff redirecting them.
Correction Narrative: 3 staff interviewed stated that they keep night logs where they are to sign off every 10 minutes starting at 9 pm, until 10:30 pm where they conduct hourly checks. During these checks staff are to also record what residents are doing.

Deficiency Narrative: Video footage confirmed staff did not check on the children at the 10 minute time frame as stated in their service plan.
Correction Narrative:
In response to your findings regarding Investigation #3013946 at Operation #215752, the staff member involved in the incident was terminated prior to our receiving your report for violation of both Minimum Standards and agency policy.  She is not eligible for rehire.
On 8/30/23 an in-person inspection was conducted, and 3 staff members were interviewed. Staff stated that at 9pm they are to record in their log every 10min the time of the check in, the activity the child is performing (mainly sleeping) and sign off. At 10:30pm staff are to conduct hourly checks and record it in the log.

Deficiency Narrative: There was at least 5 instances where a triggered review should have been conducted based on having at least 4 or more restraints within a 7-day period.

We also had a treatment plan meeting on her 8/2/23 (However, she was discharge prior to her triggered review due date of 8/6/23 Â– she discharged 8/4/23. On 09/15/23 5 staff and 2 children confirmed that restraints have been recently changed to 30 minutes of maximum time.

Deficiency Narrative:
Video footage shows staff forcing another child to sit and watch restraint with another child. Children interviewed also corroborated with another child sitting in and

Correction Narrative:
On 9/5/23 an email was sent stating that, "In the future, should a staff person flagrantly violate Hill Country Youth Ranch policy and DFPS. 
Minimum Standards regarding Emergency Behavioral Intervention with no remorse or acknowledgement of wrongdoing or desire to rectify the error through training and development of enhanced skills their employment with Hill Country Youth Ranch will be terminated."

On 9/15/23 3 children and 3 staff confirmed that when de-escalating a child, they will remove them from others. If this is not possible then
staff will remove the other children by asking them to go into their rooms as they de-escalate with child in the main area. Children added that staff will allow them to use their coping methods.

On 9/15/23 3 staff and 3 children interviewed stated that in order to conduct a proper restraint you are to use all de-escalation techniques.
When all those methods have failed then staff is to notify child that a restraint will be placed if they don't use their coping techniques.

Deficiency Narrative: The debriefing was not conducted within 24 hours of the child's return. The debriefing did not include the child's condition or what occurred during the time away.

On 6/1/23, the agency emailed the changes to the debriefing report to include all requirements. 


On 6/16/23 an inspection follow-up was conducted. 3 staff members and 2 residents were interviewed about what is discussed during the debriefing process. Both staff and residents stated that residents are checked to make sure there are no marks/bruises. It is also discussed that staff will ask residents what occurred during their time away and if child refuses then it is noted in the incident report. Staff make sure to try and have the debriefing within 24 hours.

3 out of 4 staff stated that les restrictive interventions could have been used prior to conducting an Emergency Behavior Intervention.

Deficiency Narrative: 1 out of 4 children has not received their hearing exam.

9/9/22: A physical walkthrough was conducted of the facility and photos were taken and uploaded on digital storage to show that fridges were repaired.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff pushed child and was observed on camera doing so.
Correction Narrative:
The former staff reported his version of the incident to a supervisor immediately. He also reported 
the incident to licensing. The former staff was moved to another Assessment Center pending the 
results of the investigation. Once HCYR Administrators were able to review the video 
surveillance, he was immediately terminated. Supporting staff present during incident was 
retrained in Reporting Serious Incidents. Supervisors continue to conduct unannounced visits and 
provide support through training and staffing meetings. Program Supervisors randomly monitor 
video surveillance weekly. All legal guardians were notified of Minimum Standard citation.

Deficiency Narrative: A staff member was present when a child was pushed, yelled at and restrained by another staff member and did nothing to intervene.
Correction Narrative:
A staff member present did not intervene when the situation became non-therapeutic. The staff 
person was given a written warning and retrained in Reporting Suspected Abuse or Neglect. The 
staff member will also take training courses in SAMA (EBI Interventions) and Documenting 
Serious Events.

08/16/22, inspector completed walk through of operation and addressed all concerns. No physical site concerns noted.

Deficiency Narrative: A child in care was so distraught after the staff member pushed the child into their room and closed the door that the child began banging loudly on the door to her room.
Correction Narrative:
The Program Supervisor meets with his team weekly to provide support and training as needed. 
Program Coordinators are available during awake hours to process with children and staff. 

08/16/22, inspector completed walk through of operation and addressed all concerns. No physical site concerns noted.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff member told a child in care that if they did not go to their room they would put the child there, then grabbed the child by the arm and escorted the child to the bedroom.
Correction Narrative:
The staff member involved in the incident was terminated after reviewing the video surveillance. 
HCYR does not condone punishment of children. All staff receive training in EBI, TBRI, and 
other trainings related to working with children who have suffered various trauma. HCYR utilizes 
SAMA physical containment techniques only when necessary for the childÂ’s safety or safety of 
others. Staff found to violate HCYRÂ’s EBI Procedures are subject to disciplinary action, up to and including termination. 

08/16/22, inspector completed walk through of operation and addressed all concerns. No physical site concerns noted.

Deficiency Narrative: Child in care was stung by a bee at approximately 3:30 pm. Face sheet and service plan document child is allergic to bee stings. Later in the evening child stated they were having trouble breathing and started to vomit. Staff stated they did not feel child was having trouble breathing but gave child inhaler and administered Epi pen. Staff stated they did not follow instructions for Epi pen administration because they immediately removed the pen without waiting the required amount of time for medication to be fully injected. After child in care was administered the Epi pen incorrectly the child did not receive immediate follow-up medical care to address allergic reaction and any possible adverse reactions to the Epi pen. According to SIR, when child was eventually taken the emergency room the next morning the child required 2 units of IV fluids to treat dehydration. According to child, they were vomiting all night.
Correction Narrative:
Child was monitored after she reported being sting.  She did not display any symptoms requiring emergency medical attention.  The child was taken to the Emergency Room once staff reported an Epi Pen had been administered.  Child was seen by a medical professional within 24 hours of the reported sting.

08/16/22, inspector completed walk through of operation and addressed all concerns. No physical site concerns noted.

Deficiency Narrative: Operation staff stated they were not trained to administer an EPI pen and didn't know how to use.
Correction Narrative: Staff involved completed CPR/First Aid training on 5/12/2021.  Administering an Epi Pen is covered in CPR/First Aid training.  Staff also completed HCYR Medications Policy and Procedure training on 5/3/2022.  Following the incident, staff was retrained on 6/10/2022 on how to administer an Epi Pen.  Staff are trained to read and follow directions on the prescription labels which were located with the Epi Pen.  All staff are trained on how to administer an Epi Pen in CPR/First Aid.  HCYR Medications Policy and Procedure curriculum has been updated to include Epi Pen administration so staff receive refresher training annually.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff stated they were not sure if child required the Epi pen injection for allergic reaction due to bee sting but administered anyway. Staff stated child was not in distress and was not having trouble breathing. The child was given their inhaler. Staff did not request assistance from supervisor or medical professional. Child in care told staff they needed the Epi pen so staff administered.  Staff then stated they did not inject Epi pen according to instructions because they did not leave in for 10 seconds and immediately removed from child's leg, the staff then saw medication dripping from Epi pen. The staff injected the leg and then immediately took it out.
Correction Narrative: Staff involved completed CPR/First Aid training on 5/12/2021.  Administering an Epi Pen is covered in CPR/First Aid training.  Staff also completed HCYR Medications Policy and Procedure training on 5/3/2022.  Following the incident, staff was retrained on 6/10/2022 on how to administer an Epi Pen.  An Administrator-On-Call (AOC) Calendar is placed at Hosler Assessment Center who are available for emergency situations.  Staff have been reminded to call an AOC in situations that require supervisor guidance.

Deficiency Narrative: It was confirmed that a caregiver was asleep when they were supposed to be supervising children in care.
Correction Narrative: The operation responded with a corrective action plan on 06/24/2022. Operation states that the staff member in question was written up and will be attending additional training to address concerns with supervision. Staff member will also check in hourly while on duty. Assessment staff will also be completing unannounced checks. Program supervisors will monitor and make adjustments as needed.

Deficiency Narrative: One out of six medication records was observed not having an accurate daily count.
Correction Narrative:
An email was received from Designee stating the following: The medication log noted 20 pills remaining, however, only 19 remained in the blister pack. The medication was given correctly and no medications were missed. Blister #24 was sealed without being filled. HCYR received 29 tablets instead of 30 as noted on the label. This error was not discovered by Medication Coordinator or staff who administered the medication prior to March 14, 2022.
The error was documented in an Incident Report and the count was corrected on the blister pack. The Medication Coordinator will ensure that she verifies all counts on prescriptions received. Receiving staff will also verify counts when they receive medications. All receiving staff will sign for receipt of medications.

Deficiency Narrative: It is alleged that staff became physically aggressive with a child in care and executed an improper and unwarranted restraint on the child in care which resulted in an injury.
Correction Narrative:
Operation intervened and staff member is no longer at the facility. 
Operation will be installing cameras in common areas. They will also be providing additional training on EBI for staff.

Deficiency Narrative: Staff member was providing vapes and smoking with children in care.
Correction Narrative:
An email was received by the operation that they will be putting up cameras in the common areas. 
Staff member involved is no longer working at the operation.
Staff and children not allowed to have tobacco products. Anyone violating will be subject to disciplinary actions.

Deficiency Narrative: Observed 3 door frames broken with nails protruding in children's bedrooms and 1 broken wall panel in a child's bathroom.
Correction Narrative:
Received an email on 3/8/22 from Administrator stating that the doors were repaired the same day as inspection date. Photos were provided. In addition, the bathroom materials have been ordered and will be repaired by a contractor on 3/10/22. The Administrator will provide additional photos when completed. 
3/10/22: An email was received from the Administrator containing photos of the wall now repaired.

Deficiency Narrative: There was 1 staff supervising total of 8 children during recreation time and three of the children receive treatment services.
Correction Narrative: Standard was reviewed and is in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: A volunteer did not have all the required trainings to be a caregiver for children and supervised 8 residents with a staff.
Correction Narrative: Standard was reviewed and is in compliance.

Deficiency Narrative: It was determined that the unauthorized absence was not reported within the required 6 hour time frame.
Correction Narrative: 01/07/2022 Email received from operation stating that staff involved were reminded of reporting timeframes in standards & reporting charts have been given to programs for easy access. Directors will ensure that all serious incidents are reported timely.

Deficiency Narrative: Child in care contracted a communicable disease that was not reported within 24 hours after becoming aware of illness.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the Executive Director stating that although HCYR took immediate action and provided the proper care once informed of a positive result, HCYR did not inform licensing within the 24 hour standard requirement.  HCYR will ensure that all children who contract a reportable communicable disease are reported to Licensing no later than 24 hours after receiving a confirmed report.  HCYR will continue to report confirmed cases to the childÂ’s guardian.

Deficiency Narrative: One staff member used foul language towards a child in care. Another staff member laughed at a child in care.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the Administrator stating that The Program Director met with staff involved. Staff understand that they are not to repeat foul language stated by residents and are to maintain a therapeutic atmosphere when children are present.

Deficiency Narrative: One over the counter medication was observed not in a locked container.
A child in care was diagnosed with a hand fracture and a report to Licensing was not made within required time frames.
Correction Narrative: An email was received from the Administrator stating that the incident was processed with staff and a memo was sent to all staff covering the Reportable Protocol to help ensure all steps are covered when their is an injury.
